heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as 
(Associations) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2021. 

the Garda Síochána 

(2) The collective citation “the Garda Síochána (Associations) Regulations 

1978 to 2021” includes these Regulations.

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)) and section 59(2) of the
heading: 3. (1) A relevant meeting or a relevant conference need not be held at a
text_raw:
3. (1) A relevant meeting or a relevant conference need not be held at a 
physical venue but may be conducted wholly or partly by the use of electronic 
communications technology so long as all attendees have a reasonable 
opportunity to participate in the meeting or conference in accordance with this 
Regulation. 

(2) 

(a) Provision may be made in standing orders or otherwise for 
participation in a relevant meeting or relevant conference by the 
use of electronic communications technology, including for a 
mechanism for casting votes by an attendee, whether before or 
during the meeting or conference. 

(b) The mechanism referred to in paragraph (a) shall not require the 
attendee to be physically present at the relevant meeting or 
relevant conference or require the attendee to appoint a proxy 
who is to be physically present at the meeting or conference. 

(3) Any temporary failure or disruption of electronic communications 
technology shall not invalidate a relevant meeting or relevant conference 
merely by virtue of that temporary failure or disruption. 

(4) In this Regulation - 

 “attendee” means - 

(a) 

(b) 

in relation to a relevant meeting, a member of the district or any 
other person attending the meeting, and 

in relation to a relevant conference, a delegate to the conference 
or any other person attending the conference; 

“electronic communications technology”, in relation to a relevant meeting or 
relevant conference, means technology that enables real-time transmission and 
real-time two-way audio or audio-visual communication enabling attendees to 
participate in the meeting or conference using such technology from a remote 
location; 

“relevant conference” means any of the following conferences of the 
Association in respect of the year 2021: 

(a) 

(b) 

the Annual Delegate Conference; 

a Special Delegate Conference; 

“relevant meeting” means any of the following meetings of the members of a 
district in respect of the year 2021: 

(a) 

(b) 

the Annual General Meeting; 

a special general meeting. 

Annual General Meetings of District Committees

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)) and section 59(2) of the
heading: 4. Notwithstanding Regulation 8(4) of the Regulations of 1998, an Annual
text_raw:
4. Notwithstanding Regulation 8(4) of the Regulations of 1998, an Annual 
General Meeting of the members of a district in respect of the year 2021 may 
be held as soon as is practicable after the making of these Regulations - 

 
 
 4 [603] 

(a) 

(b) 

in the year 2021, or 

in the year 2022 prior to the holding of the Annual General 
Meeting of the members of the district in respect of the year

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)) and section 59(2) of the
heading: Annual Delegate Conference for year 2021

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)) and section 59(2) of the
heading: 5. Notwithstanding Regulation 12(4) of the Regulations of 1998, the
text_raw:
5. Notwithstanding Regulation 12(4) of the Regulations of 1998, the 
Annual Delegate Conference in respect of the year 2021 (in these Regulations 
referred to as the “2021 Annual Delegate Conference”) may be held at any 
time on or after 23 November 2021 and prior to 1 January 2022. 

Standing Orders Committee
text_norm: 5 notwithstanding regulation 12(4) regulation 1998 annual delegate conference respect year 2021 (in regulation referred 2021 annual delegate conference ) may held time 23 november 2021 prior 1 january 2022 standing order committee

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)) and section 59(2) of the
heading: 6. Notwithstanding Regulation 13(1) of the Regulations of 1998, the
text_raw:
6. Notwithstanding Regulation 13(1) of the Regulations of 1998, the 
election of the Standing Orders Committee referred to in that Regulation by the 
2021 Annual Delegate Conference may be done by secret ballot carried out 
using electronic communications technology. 

Trustees
text_norm: 6 notwithstanding regulation 13(1) regulation 1998 election standing order committee referred regulation 2021 annual delegate conference may done secret ballot carried using electronic communication technology trustee

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)) and section 59(2) of the
heading: 7. Notwithstanding Regulation 21(2) of the Regulations of 1998 -
text_raw:
7. Notwithstanding Regulation 21(2) of the Regulations of 1998 - 

(a) 

(b) 

the Trustee elected by the Annual Delegate Conference in 2016 
shall hold office until the close of the 2021 Annual Delegate 
Conference, and 

the Trustee elected by the 2021 Annual Delegate Conference in 
accordance with that Regulation shall hold office until the close 
of the Annual Delegate Conference in 2026. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The Government hereby approve of the foregoing Regulations. 

[603] 5 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Government, 

16 November, 2021. 

MICHEÁL MARTIN, 

Taoiseach. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Justice, 

16 November, 2021. 

HELEN MCENTEE, 
Minister for Justice.
